summary: The contact owned a 2014 Lexus RX350. The contact stated that while the wife was driving approximately 35 mph a dump truck collided with the passenger side of the vehicle. During the crash, the side curtain air bags did not deploy. The front passenger sustained injuries to the head, neck, shoulder, and torso and the front driver sustained injuries to the right foot and chest area. Medical treatment was required for both occupants. The vehicle was destroyed and towed away. A police report was taken at the scene. The cause of the failure was not determined. The local dealer and manufacturer were not yet contacted. The failure mileage was 44,000.

Driving the car on the highway.  The transmission lost power & engine  started revving with no movement. It was dangerous because we could have been rear ended. We had car towed to the Peterson Lexus dealer in Boise Idaho. They said that the internal bearing failed & recommend a new transmission.

My car stalled in the middle of an intersection.  It had to be towed to the Lexus dealer, where it was determined to be a fuel pump malfunction.  My car was not subject to the fuel pump recall but it should have been.

When I press on my brakes they make a loud roaring sound right away. Usually when brakes are about to go out its usually a squeaky noise then it will go to loud roaring noise. There has not been an indicator on the dash about any issues with the vehicle. I found it rather odd that the brakes made the roaring noise immediately. It didn't squeak at all. I would like for this matter to be looked into. There is no way there should be a brake system failure right away. The schrader valve has a crack and freon is leaking out of and the air is not blowing cold air.

WHILE DRIVING MY 2014 LEXUS RX350 AT 60MPH ON INTERSTATE I-10, MY SUNROOF SUDDENLY EXPLODED OUTWARDS!  NO SIGNS OF ROAD DEBRIS  NOR ANY OTHER VEHICLES IN VICINITY  AFTER STOPPING, IT WAS CLEAR THAT  THE REMAINING GLASS SHOWED THAT THERE WAS NO IMPACT AND THE GLASS SHATTERED OUTWARDS. WHEN INVESTIGATING ONLINE, I NOTICED THAT THIS COULD BE THE RESULT OF A DEFECT  KNOWN BY THE AUTO INDUSTRY INCLUDING  TOYOTA/LEXUS.  I AM THANKFUL THAT THE INTERIOR SHIELD FOR THE SUNROOF WAS CLOSED FOR THE  SHATTERED GLASS COULD HAVE ENTERED THE PASSENGER COMPARTMENT WITH POSSIBLE INJURY.

CAR HAD 70,000 MILES AND THE TRANSMISSION WENT OUT. CAR WAS HAVING ISSUES WITH CRANKING, GETTING ERROR CODES FOR TECHNOLOGY, AND CAR SOUNDING LOUDLY AND SKIPPONG ALONG WITH NOT CHANGING OUT PROPERLY. DEALER NEVER FOUND A PROBLEM, BEYOND TECHNOLOGY, UNTIL THE TRANSMISSION WENT OUT. DEALER AGREED TO PAY FOR NEW TRANSMISSION 1 YEAR WARRANTY BUT NOT LABOR. CAR WOULD HESITATE TO START AND COULD HAVE BROKEN DOWN ON HIGHWAY HAD I NOT DENSND AN INSPECTION AGAIN, ONE WEEK AFTER THE DEALER CLAIM MY CAR WAS FIX AND IT WAS ONLY THE BATTERY.

TL* THE CONTACT OWNS A 2014 LEXUS RX350. WHILE DRIVING APPROXIMATELY 45 MPH, A LOUD BOOMING SOUND WAS PRESENT. UPON INSPECTION, IT WAS DISCOVERED THAT THE GLASS SUN ROOF HAD SHATTERED. THE CONTACT INDICATED THAT THE SUN ROOF WAS CLOSED DURING THE FAILURE. THE CAUSE OF THE FAILURE WAS NOT DETERMINED. AN UNKNOWN DEALER WAS CONTACTED AND A SERVICE APPOINTMENT WAS SCHEDULED. THE MANUFACTURER WAS NOT NOTIFIED. THE FAILURE MILEAGE WAS 69,000.

CRACK IN WINDSHIELD STARTING  ON PASSENGER SIDE JUST ABOVE THE BLACKISH  PART AT THE LOWER PART OF THE WINDSHIELD , EXTENDING UP FOR ABOUT 3 INCHES THEN MAKING ABOUT A 95 DEGREE TURN HEADING TOWARD THE DRIVERS SIDE.  WHEN FIRST NOTICED, THIS SECTION WAS ONLY ABOUT 3 INCHES LONG ALSO, BUT 2 DAYS LATER, IT EXTENDED ABOUT 2 FEET.    NO APPARENT OR REMEMBERING ANY OBJECT STRIKING THE WINDSHIELD.  NO CHIP SEEN.  JUST NOTICED WHEN GOT IN CAR TO START IT THE MORNING STATED.  THE 2 FOOT EXTENSION OCCURED WHILE DRIVING 2 DAYS LATER

VEHICLE TAKEN IN FOR EMISSIONS TEST/RENEWAL IN MARCH 2016. AFTER WORK COMPLETED, MADE SEVERAL STOPS AND "DRIVERS" SEAT SETTING (#1) WOULD NOT RETURN TO ORIGINAL EXIT SETTING THAT I HAD PROGRAMMED. THE STEERING WHEEL ALWAYS MOVES INTO THE DRIVING POSITION, BUT THE SEAT WOULD NOT. ADVISED SERVICE DEPT SAME DAY BUT AFTER BUSINESS HOURS THAT I WOULD BRING IT IN TO CORRECT WHATEVER WAS DONE SO THAT IT WOULD WORK PROPERLY. RETURNED NEXT DAY, SERVICE TICKET NOT WRITTEN, AND DEMONSTRATED PROBLEM WITH SERVICE ADVISOR, WHO ALSO SAT IN THE VEHICLE AND SAW THE SAME RESULTS. TO DATE PROBLEM NOT FIXED, AND SEAT WORKS SOMETIMES & SOMETIMES IT DOES NOT. ON SECOND VISIT, MECHANIC SUPPOSEDLY FIXED & I GOT INTO MY CAR AND IT STILL DID NOT WORK. DRIVING POSITION IS SUPPOSE TO WORK WHEN SEAT BELT IS ENGAGED  OR VEHICLE SWITCH IS PRESSED.

TL* THE CONTACT OWNS A 2014 LEXUS RX350. WHILE DRIVING AT A LOW SPEED, ANOTHER VEHICLE CRASHED INTO THE DRIVER SIDE OF THE CONTACT'S VEHICLE. THE AIR BAGS FAILED TO DEPLOY. THE CONTACT SUSTAINED HEAD, NECK, BACK, AND SHOULDER INJURIES THAT REQUIRED MEDICAL ATTENTION. A POLICE REPORT WAS FILED. THE VEHICLE WAS TOWED TO AN AUTO BODY REPAIR CENTER. THE VEHICLE WAS NOT REPAIRED. THE MANUFACTURER WAS NOTIFIED OF THE FAILURE. THE FAILURE MILEAGE WAS 13,305.   UPDATED 4/20/15*CN    UPDATED 9/28/2017*CN
CAR PARKED ON A DRIVEWAY AND SLIPPED OUT OF PARK AND DOWN THE DRIVEWAY INTO A NEIGHBORS TREE ACROSS THE STREET.  *TR

TL*  THE CONTACT OWNS A 2014 LEXUS RX350 EQUIPPED WITH MICHELIN, TIRE LINE: LATITUDE TOUR AND TIRE SIZE: P235/55R19 (N/A). THE CONTACTED THAT WHILE DRIVING AT 30 MPH, THE TIRE PRESSURE WARNING LIGHT ILLUMINATED. THE VEHICLE WAS TAKEN TO A DEALER, WHO DIAGNOSED THAT THE FRONT DRIVER AND REAR SIDE TIRES WERE PUNCTURED WITH UNKNOWN OBJECTS. THE TIRES WERE REPLACED. THE MANUFACTURER WAS NOTIFIED OF THE FAILURE. THE APPROXIMATE FAILURE MILEAGE WAS 6,000. DJR

THE CONTACT OWNS A 2014 LEXUS RX 350. WHILE ATTEMPTING TO PARK THE VEHICLE AFTER A COMPLETE STOP,  DURING THE (GEAR) SHIFTING FROM DRIVE TO PARK, THE VEHICLE SUDDENLY ACCELERATED AND HIT / CRASHED ON TO A BUILDING AND SPUN OFF, AND THE IMPACT CAUSED THE VEHICLE TO TRAVEL FOR ABOUT 15 FEET AND STOPPED.  AIR BAGS DID NOT DEPLOY AND A POLICE REPORT WAS FILED.  NO INJURIES TO ANYONE.  THE VEHICLE WAS TOWED TO THE LEXUS DEALERSHIP AND LATER TO DEALERSHIP'S COLLISION SHOP.  APPROXIMATE ESTIMATE FOR THE REPAIR IS $21,000.  MANUFACTURER WAS NOTIFIED THROUGH THE EMAIL OPTION IN LEXUS CUSTOMER ASSISTANCE CENTER.  APPROXIMATE FAILURE MILEAGE WAS 5,500.  IT APPEARS TO BE AN ISSUE WITH THE ENGINE OR SOME INTERNAL ELECTRONIC SYSTEM.  BECAUSE, WHEN THIS INCIDENT HAPPENED, THE VEHICLE WAS AT A COMPLETE STOP AND MY (DRIVER) FOOT WAS ON THE BRAKE PEDAL.  *TR

TL* THE CONTACT OWNS A 2014 LEXUS RX350. WHILE ATTEMPTING TO PARK THE VEHICLE, THE BRAKE PEDAL FAILED TO RESPOND WHEN IT WAS DEPRESSED. THE FAILURE CAUSED THE CONTACT TO CRASH THE VEHICLE INTO A TREE. THE AIR BAGS FAILED TO DEPLOY. A POLICE REPORT WAS FILED AND THERE WERE NO INJURIES REPORTED. THE VEHICLE WAS TOWED TO AN INDEPENDENT MECHANIC. THE VEHICLE WAS NOT DIAGNOSED OR REPAIRED. THE MANUFACTURER WAS NOT NOTIFIED OF THE FAILURE. THE SPEED WAS UNKNOWN. THE APPROXIMATE FAILURE MILEAGE WAS 3,600.

TL* THE CONTACT OWNS A 2014 LEXUS RX350. THE CONTACT STATED THAT THERE WAS A DISTORTION ON THE WINDSHIELD THAT CAUSED THE CONTACT TO BECOME PHYSICALLY ILL. THE VEHICLE WAS TAKEN TO THE DEALER WHERE IT WAS ADVISED TO THE CONTACT THAT THE VEHICLE WAS PERFORMING AS DESIGNED. THE MANUFACTURER WAS MADE AWARE OF THE FAILURE. THE APPROXIMATE FAILURE MILEAGE WAS 3,000.

TL * THE CONTACT OWNS A 2014 LEXUS RX350.  WHILE DRIVING 5 MPH, THE VEHICLE FAILED TO STOP WHEN THE BRAKE PEDAL WAS DEPRESSED.  THE CONTACT CRASHED INTO A LIGHT POLE, WHICH THEN FELL ONTO THE WINDSHIELD AND THE HOOD OF THE VEHICLE.  THE AIR BAGS FAILED TO DEPLOY.  THE VEHICLE WAS DESTROYED, BUT THE CONTACT WAS UNINJURED.  A POLICE REPORT WAS FILED.  THE MANUFACTURER WAS NOT NOTIFIED.  THE FAILURE MILEAGE WAS 3,500.  UPDATED 08/19/14*LJ   THE LIGHT POLE BOUNCED OFF THE VEHICLE, AND FELL IN THE STREET. UPDATED 08/21/14

2.5 MONTHS OLD WITH 2200 MILES HAS A LEAKY FRONT RIGHT SHOCK.  THE DEALER SAYS THE SHOCKS ARE ON BACK ORDER NATIONWIDE AND IT WILL TAKE 2 WEEKS TO GET THE PART.  IT SOUNDS LIKE A POSSIBLE RECALL PROBLEM.      THEY WILL REPLACE IT UNDER WARRANTY NOW, BUT  THIS MAY HAPPEN AGAIN RIGHT AFTER THE WARRANTY RUNS OUT.  CAR FEELS UNSAFE TO DRIVE, BUT THE DEALER INSISTS IT IS SAFE.  THE NOISE AND ROUGH HANDLING IS MORE NOTICEABLE IN LOW SPEEDS, BUT IT IS FELT AT ALL SPEEDS.  THE PROBLEM STARTED ON SATURDAY AND GOT MUCH WORSE BY MONDAY.  *TR

TL* THE CONTACT OWNS A 2014 LEXUS RX350. THE CONTACT STATED THAT SHE OPENED THE LIFT GATE WITH THE AUTOMATED BUTTON TO GIVE A PASSENGER ACCESS TO THE REAR. THE CONTACT ACCIDENTALLY DEPRESSED THE AUTOMATED BUTTON FROM INSIDE OF THE VEHICLE AND THE LIFE GATE SLAMMED ON THE PASSENGER'S HEAD, CAUSING HIS SCALP TO BECOME SPLIT OPEN. THE PASSENGER WAS TRANSPORTED TO THE HOSPITAL WHERE THREE STAPLES WERE USED TO CLOSE HIS HEAD INJURY. THE VEHICLE WAS TAKEN TO THE DEALER BUT WAS NOT INSPECTED OR REPAIRED. THE MANUFACTURER WAS NOTIFIED OF THE FAILURE. THE FAILURE MILEAGE WAS 1,700.  UPDATED 04/29/14*LJ
